div.p:
svasti śrī kampavarmmaṟku yāṇṭu patināñcāvatu Uṭkar sabhaiyōm Eḻuttuc caṭaiyaṉ pakkal āyira-k-kāṭi nel koṇ
ṭōm Ivv-āyira-k-kāṭi nellālum palicai Aynnūṟṟukkāṭi nel āṭṭāṇṭu tōṟum ērikk’ aṭṭi Ikuttuvippōm āṉōm sabhai
yōm Iit’ aṉṟ’ eṉṟār kaṅkai Iṭaik= kumari Iṭai ceytār ceyta pāvam paṭuvar āka-p paṇittōm sam•batsaravāriyapperumakkaḷē Aṭṭuvik=ka kaṭavār |

app.note: notes: “palicai is another form of policai; see the Index to vol. I. s.v. paliśai, and Dr. Gundert’s Malayâḷam Dictionary, s.v. paliśa.”
In ṉō, the kāl is marked twice, as a kāl proper and as a curl added to ṉ.
It seems that the final r is followed by a short daṇḍa

div.p: Writings (i.e. writ) of We the members of the sabhā of Uṭkar.
We have got (i.e. received) one thousand kāṭi from Caṭaiyaṉ.

Having endowed/supplied (aṭṭi) for the tank the interest of five hundred kāṭi every year (which comes) through the paddy of these one thousand kāṭi, We, the members of the sabhā are those who will close (it, i.e. the sluice of the tank).
Those who say it is not so, let them undergo the sin done by those who do (ceytār) (sin) between the Ganges and Kumari (i.e. Kaṉṉiyākumari).
The great men of the committee for the year are due to/should/have the duty of (kaṭavār) having it (the five hundred kāṭi) flowing/being supplied/endowed.
First edited by with English translation and facsimile (SII 3, no. 5). Edited and summarised in (IP no. 215). This edition by Emmanuel Francis, based on autopsy and photographs (2019).
